column1: Nine people have been killed after an oxygen ventilator exploded at a hospital treating coronavirus patients in southern Turkey
column2: officials say.The blast caused a fire in the intensive care unit of the private Sanko University Hospital in Gaziantep
column3: the local governor's office said.At least one of the patients died while being transferred to another hospital.No injuries were reported in relation to the fire
column4: which occurred in the early hours of Saturday morning and was quickly put out.The victims were aged between 56 and 85
column5: the hospital said in a statement.An investigation is under way to determine the cause of the explosion. Several other patients being treated at the same ward were transferred to receive treatment at nearby hospitals
column6: the Gaziantep governor's office said. "Authorities have taken the necessary measures
column7: the statement said, while offering condolences to the families of the victims. Turkish presidential spokesman Ibrahim Kalin tweeted to wish urgent healing to the wounded"
column10: more than 150 patients at a makeshift coronavirus hospital in the Russian region of Chelyabinsk had to be evacuated when an explosion in an "oxygen booth" caused a fire
